revised_title: Surveying and Measuring a Base on Hounslow-Heath
tldr: The author, Major-General William Roy, describes the process of measuring a base on Hounslow-Heath for the purpose of creating accurate maps and surveys. This work was undertaken to improve the understanding of the country's geography and aid in military planning. The measurement of the base was the first step in creating a series of triangles that would connect various points in the country, ultimately leading to more accurate maps and better understanding of the land.
